articles.title: California's air now the dirtiest in the world
articles.description: Wildfires have caused the air quality in California to reach hazardous levels. The air quality is considered the dirtiest in the world. Dr. Jon LaPook reports.

articles.title: Trump meets California officials as wildfire death toll rises
articles.description: President Trump met with fire officials in California after blaming the devastation on poor forest management. The Camp Fire devastated Northern California, burning through 148,000 acres. Meg Oliver reports.

articles.title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Saturday, November 17, 2018
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Weekend News" with Reena Ninan.

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.title: Moment in Nature: Wild turkeys
articles.description: "Sunday Morning" takes viewers to California's Marin County
articles.content: "Sunday Morning" took viewers today to watch wild turkeys in California's Marin County, just north of San Francisco. The footage was by videographer Lee McEachern. According to Scientific American, about a quarter-million wild turkeys ( Meleagris gallopavo ) … [+740 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: A heartwarming slice of life: Pizza made and served by the deaf
articles.description: San Francisco's Mozzeria, ranked among the top pizza places in the city, is also entirely owned and operated by people who are deaf
articles.content: San Francisco has some of the best restaurants anywhere – and one of the most unique. Mozzeria, ranked among the top pizza places in the city, is also one of the first to be entirely owned and operated by people who are deaf. Melody and Russell Stein opened t… [+2961 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Bowled over for breakfast
articles.description: What happened when food blogger Wil Fulton tried an experiment of eating nothing but breakfast cereal for a week? And with egg sandwich sales increasing for breakfast, how are cereal makers trying to re-energize their brands?
articles.content: Wil Fulton admits that as a kid cereal just bowled him over. His favorites included Lucky Charms, Cinnamon Toast Crunch, Rice Krispies (all the varieties, like Cocoa Rice Krispies and Rice Krispy Treats). Some 20 years later, Fulton is writing for the website… [+4522 chars]

articles.author: Elizabeth Campbell
articles.title: Pelosi picks up 2 more Democratic votes in bid for speaker
articles.description: Four representatives elect talk the future of their parties and political discourse in America.
articles.content: Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi can add two more yes votes in her hunt to get to 218 to win election as speaker of the House in January. Reps.-elect Joe Neguse, D-Colo., and Chrissy Houlahan, D-Penn., announced their support for Pelosi on "Face the Nation" Sun… [+3398 chars]

articles.author: Caroline Linton
articles.title: Democrat Andrew Gillum concedes Florida governor's race
articles.description: A machine recount ended Thursday, and still had DeSantis leading by over 3,000 votes
articles.content: Florida Democratic candidate for governor Andrew Gillum officially conceded on Saturday to Republican Ron DeSantis, two days after a machine recount ended. The machine recount had DeSantis still leading by over 3,000 votes. The Tallahassee mayor congratulated… [+1231 chars]

articles.title: Trump visits areas affected by California wildfires
articles.description: President Trump visited the devastation in Paradise, California, after a deadly wildfire nearly leveled the entire community. The president declined to say whether climate change directly impacted the fires, saying there were "a lot of factors."

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: The Sioux Chef
articles.description: Native American chef Sean Sherman's goal is not just to produce a healthy meal based on indigenous cultures, but to feed the soul of a nation
articles.content: "You can throw a dart at a map of North America, and wherever it lands, there's gonna be culture, food, people and flavor to play with right there, and so many stories to tell you can write a book," said chef Sean Sherman. And he's done just that. For Sherman… [+2719 chars]

articles.title: Georgia town evacuates after rail cars fall from overpass
articles.description: CSX Railroad said 30 cars derailed, including some that fell from the overpass onto Highway 90 at Byromville
articles.content: BYROMVILLE, Ga. — Rail cars tumbled from an overpass onto a Georgia highway on Saturday, causing an evacuation and traffic headaches in a small town. No injuries were reported Saturday. CSX Railroad said 30 cars derailed. That included some that fell from the… [+1064 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Sparkling water is making a splash
articles.description: Thanks in part to increased health consciousness, sales of carbonated water is bubbling over
articles.content: What was silly business for The Three Stooges, who made a career out of squirting seltzer bottles, is all business for Alex Gomberg. He's a fourth-generation seltzer man, working at the Brooklyn-based company started by his great-grandfather, Moe. You could s… [+2416 chars]

articles.title: 11/16/18: CBSN Evening News

articles.title: 11/16: CBS Evening News
articles.description: Trump says he answered written questions from Mueller "very easily"; Soldier says a stranger's Christmas card got him through the Vietnam War.

articles.title: Hundreds still missing in California's Camp Fire
articles.description: President Trump is set to visit Northern California on Saturday to speak with victims and First Responders of the deadly wildfires. CBS News' DeMarco Morgan reports from Chico, California, on the search and rescue efforts.

articles.title: Soldier says a stranger's Christmas card got him through the Vietnam War
articles.description: When John Metzler served in the Vietnam War, he got a Christmas card from a little girl he didn't know. He said it helped him get through the war. Decades later, he met the sender. Steve Hartman has their story "On The Road."

articles.title: Boy writes letter to his parents during school lockdown: "Goodbye"
articles.description: Ajani Dartiguenave, 12, was filled with fear during a lockdown at his school. He wrote a goodbye letter to his parents thinking he was about to die. CBS News' Nikki Battiste reports.

articles.title: William Goldman, Oscar-winning screenwriter, has died at 87
articles.description: William Goldman, who write the book and screenplay for the "The Princess Bride" and other books and movies, has died. The Academy Award winner was 87. CBS News senior national correspondent Jim Axelrod looks back at his life.

articles.title: Betsy DeVos proposes major overhaul in how colleges handle sex assault claims
articles.description: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos is proposing an overhaul in the way colleges handle sexual assault accusations. It gives more rights to students who are accused. CBS News chief legal correspondent Jan Crawford reports.
